issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The described issue is not actually a problem - it is as designed.
resolution.name: Not A Problem

fields.summary: The demand of FSAppAttempt may be negative

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Resource object use int to store memory field.When int exceed Integer,MAX_VALUE,you will get a
neagtive num of demand in FSQueue#updateDemand(),and your queue will nerver get assign forever.
I find this scenario still now in lasted code 3.0.x.
fields.summary: Resource.add exceed Int boundary,when compute queue demand in FairScheduler

comments.body: [~leftnoteasy],Please assign to me,i would like to work on it.

[~Feng Yuan], I just added you to contributor list so in the future you can assign JIRA to yourself.  :)

Does this issue affect only fair scheduler or potentially all schedulers will be affected?

Thank you,[~leftnoteasy],I roughly checked CapacityScheduler,and did not find somewhere need to compute demand,
and i am not very familiar with CapacityScheduler.
Please tell me if i mistake.

Hi [~zjshen],could you give me some help?
I get stuck at submit patch. What does this mean "does not apply to trunk. Rebase required?,"
Is there something i need config?
Thank you!
It means that the git apply of your patch didn't succeed.  Did you perhaps create the patch against a branch instead of trunk?

This message was automatically generated.
The fix version should not be set until the patch is committed.

Looks to me like the reason your patch is failing is that you have a local commit in your tree.  If you run "git status", does it tell you that your local repo is "ahead of 'apache/hadoop' by <n> commits"?

Thanks [~templedf],what confuse me is why does the system try to apply my patch to trunk.
I have create it base on branch-2.8.Is there any configuration in this page is wrong?
Should i modify some of them such as "affects versions"?
